relationships.notes: Travels with Paul after the Jerusalem council, endures imprisonment in Philippi, and co-preaches Christ to Corinthian and Macedonian assemblies.
Joins Timothy in relaying reports from Macedonia and appears with him as a co-author of letters to the Thessalonians, reflecting shared pastoral responsibility.
Named by 1 Peter as the faithful brother through whom the letter is written or delivered, extending his reputation beyond Paul’s circle.

traits.jerusalem_leader: Introduced as a leading man among the brothers in Jerusalem, chosen to accompany Paul and Barnabas with the council’s letter to Antioch.
traits.prophetic_and_pastoral_role: Described as a prophet who encourages and strengthens the believers with many words.
traits.companion_of_paul: Becomes Paul’s chief companion on the second missionary journey after the split with Barnabas, traveling through Syria, Cilicia, and into Macedonia and Achaia.
traits.imprisonment_and_witness: Imprisoned with Paul in Philippi, prays and sings hymns at midnight before the earthquake that leads to the jailer’s conversion.
traits.missionary_activity: Participates in founding and strengthening communities in cities such as Philippi, Thessalonica, and Berea, later remaining behind while Paul moves on.
traits.narrative_profile: Embodies a Spirit-led coworker whose suffering, encouragement, and mobility support Paul’s wider Gentile mission.

traits.co_sender_and_coworker: Named as Silvanus alongside Paul in the opening of letters, indicating a co-sender and coworker known to the communities.
traits.preacher_of_christ: Recalled as one of those who proclaimed Christ to the Corinthians together with Paul and Timothy, emphasizing a unified message rather than competing ministries.
traits.network_presence: Appears within the circle of collaborators whose shared labor undergirds Paul’s Gentile mission.

traits.association_in_1_peter: Mentioned as Silvanus in 1 Peter as a faithful brother through whom the letter is written or delivered, reflecting his broader reputation beyond Paul’s circle.
traits.critical_note: This reference occurs outside the Pauline letters and in a text whose authorship is debated, but it contributes to the wider New Testament portrait of Silvanus as a trusted emissary.
